cerebral hypoperfusion (syncope/lipothymia) or cerebral activity dysfunction (epileptic seizure)

question.question: What is the primary pathophysiological mechanism behind malaise in adults?
question.option_a: Cerebral hypoperfusion leading to syncope or lipothymia
question.option_b: Cerebral activity dysfunction leading to an epileptic seizure
question.option_c: Cardiac arrhythmia causing sudden loss of consciousness
question.option_d: Respiratory failure leading to hypoxia and unconsciousness
